page.title: 07THE GRAND UNION CANAL
page.content: The stretch of waterway from the Flakes north of Coppermill Lock to Black Jack's Lock falls within the sphere of Hillingdon Borough's Canal Locks Conservation Area Advisory Panel.During 1985 plans for redeveloping the old industrial area to the south of Coppermill have been mooted.The Panel wanted industry to be maintained and opposed a new housing scheme here,well outside the village and adjoining chalk downland of special scientific interest.Even so, a change to residential use remains a possibility. A factory site beside the canal in South Harefield has already been turned into a housing estate - so the precedent has been set. The canal remains an important recreational site and any development should also take cognisance of this fact.
